parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering shaft can cause loss of control, accidents, and injuries, as the vehicle may suddenly veer off course or become difficult to steer.
symptoms: The steering wheel feels sloppy
drops down 1-2 inches to the left or right
the steering shaft fractures
the steering wheel ceases to function
excessive force is needed to steer
the vehicle pulls to one side
the gas pedal vibrates while turning.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering column can cause loss of control, accidents, and injuries, as the vehicle may suddenly veer off course or become difficult to steer.
symptoms: The steering shaft slides out of the back end of the steering wheel
the steering column fractures
the steering wheel ceases to function
excessive force is needed to steer
the vehicle pulls to one side.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering system can cause loss of control, accidents, and injuries, as the vehicle may suddenly veer off course or become difficult to steer.
symptoms: The steering wheel feels sloppy
drops down 1-2 inches to the left or right
excessive force is needed to steer
the vehicle pulls to one side
the gas pedal vibrates while turning
warning lights illuminate on the instrumental panel.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the Watts link can cause the rear axle to shift from side to side, making it difficult to control the vehicle, especially during turns, which can lead to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The vehicle shifts from side to side
especially during turns
the vehicle is difficult to control
the vehicle wanders or drifts while driving
the rear axle makes abnormal noises or vibrations.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden detachment of the fuel tank from the vehicle can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially lead to fuel leaks, fires, or explosions, posing a significant risk to the driver and passengers.
symptoms: Abnormal popping noise coming from the rear of the vehicle
fuel tank detaches from the vehicle without warning
possible fuel leaks.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A faulty fuel tank mounting system can cause the fuel tank to detach from the vehicle, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potentially fuel leaks, fires, or explosions, posing a significant risk to the driver and passengers.
symptoms: Abnormal noise coming from the rear of the vehicle
fuel tank detaches from the vehicle without warning
possible fuel leaks.
